page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY 2
page.content: There are many historic buildings in the area.{Brunstane House}was once called{Gilberton.}The Earl of Abercorn owned the house at one time. Later,in 1768, he built a mansion called {Duddingston House.}His estates in Ireland gave the names{Baronscourt and {Ulster}to streets in the area. In the 12th century a Norman family called{de Lestalrig}built a castle at Lochend. The name later became {Restalrig.}A chapel honouring{St. {Triduana}was built in 1128. Above this, a Chapel Royal was erected. In 1560 at the Reformation the chapel was destroyed. The church was restored in 1837 as{Restalrig Parish.}In 1892{New {Restalrig Church}was built at{Jock's {Lodge.} { Queensbay Lodge,}once owned by the Jenner family, is now an eventide home and the{King's Manor}is a hotel.
